description.description: The description of the Prometheus rule group that will be included in the alert email.

enabled.description: The flag that indicates whether the Prometheus rule group is enabled.

clusterName.description: The cluster name of the rule group evaluation.

scopes.description: The list of azure resource id's that this rule group is scoped to.

interval.description: the interval in which to run the Prometheus rule group represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Should be between 1 and 15 minutes

rules.description: defines the rules in the Prometheus rule group.

enabled.description: the flag that indicates whether the Prometheus rule is enabled.

expression.description: The PromQL expression to evaluate. Every evaluation cycle this is evaluated at the current time, and the result recorded as a new set of time series with the metric name as given by 'record'.

labels.description: Labels to add or overwrite before storing the result.

record.description: The name of the time series to output to. Must be a valid metric name.

alert.description: The name of the alert. Must be a valid metric name.

severity.description: The severity of the alerts fired by the rule.

for.description: The amount of time alert must be active before firing.

actions.description: The array of actions that are performed when the alert rule becomes active, and when an alert condition is resolved. Only relevant for alerts.

resolveConfiguration.description: defines the configuration for resolving fired alerts. Only relevant for alerts.

PrometheusRuleGroupActions.description: An alert action. Only relevant for alerts.

actionGroups.description: The resource ids of the action group to use.

actionProperties.description: The properties of an action group object.

customProperties.description: The custom properties of an action group object.

PrometheusRuleResolveConfiguration.description: Specifies the Prometheus alert rule configuration.

autoResolved.description: The flag that indicates whether or not to auto resolve a fired alert.

timeToResolve.description: the duration a rule must evaluate as healthy before the fired alert is automatically resolved represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Should be between 1 and 15 minutes

StringDictionary.description: A dictionary from string to string.
